example[2]: The floors are made of stone.
definition[1]: a small piece of rock of any shape, found on the ground
example[3]: A handful of protesters began throwing stones at the police.
definition[3]: the large hard part at the centre of some fruits, such as a peach or cherry, which contains the seed
definition[4]: a ball of hard material that can form in organs such as your bladder or kidneys
definition[5]: a British unit for measuring weight, equal to 14 pounds or 6.35 kilograms
definition[6]: to throw stones at someone or something
example[4]: Rioters blocked roads and stoned vehicles.
definition[7]: to take the stone out of fruit
